To eliminate the specified data type "d" and substitute every instance of it with its associated original data type, we'll perform the following steps:

1. Identify the data type "d" in the program.
   
   The provided program does not contain any explicit data type declaration or usage of the data type "d." Therefore, there is nothing to eliminate or substitute for "d."

2. Since there are no changes to be made, we'll proceed to write the final program into a JSON file.

Here is the JSON representation of the final program:

```json
{
  "program": "#include <stdio.h>\\n\\nvoid fn1(unsigned p1, int p2) { printf(\"checksum = %X\\n\", p1); }\\n\\nstruct p {\\n  signed ab;\\n  signed q : 22;\\n};\\n\\nstruct r {\\n  unsigned ab;\\n  unsigned s;\\n};\\n\\nstruct r t;\\n\\nunsigned u;\\n\\nstruct p v[1];\\n\\nstruct p w = {0x1C87E74FL, 816};\\n\\nunsigned fn5(unsigned p1, signed p2, unsigned p3, unsigned p4, unsigned p5) {\\n  struct p a = {8L, 666};\\n  for (p2 = 0; p2 >= 0; p2 -= 1)\\n    for (; u <= 1; u += 1) {\\n      a = v[p2] = w;\\n      v[p2] = a;\\n    }\\n}\\n\\nint main() {\\n  int b = 0;\\n  fn5(t.ab, 3, 2, t.s, 9);\\n  unsigned j = v[0].q;\\n  fn1(j, b);\\n  return 0;\\n}"
}
```

Please note that the program remains unchanged as there is no mention of the data type "d" in the provided code.
